JobFullDesc:
WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR
As a Planner of the Converse Western Europe Digital Direct team, you will drive sales, profitability, and inventory through the product launched on the converse.com platform. In this role, you will drive growth to achieve company financial plans while delivering the brand and geography priorities & vision. You will collaborate with geography and global partners to develop cohesive strategies and process to optimize the Digital business. Using data-driven insights, you will initiate and proactively partner with teams to manage the product life cycle and maximize SKU productivity.
WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON
•    Develop a product assortment planning strategy for Digital Direct across multiple product types; Footwear, Apparel and Accessories
•    Strategise and implement merchandise plans that maximize sales, margin and inventory to support financial targets
•    Create SKU-level sales, inventory, and buy flow plans
•    Effectively communicate and present to peers & leadership the merchandise planning vision, strategies, results, insights and action plans
•    Support in developing enhanced tools for future planning and analysing performance
•    Actively engage with cross-functional partners to seek opportunities and efficiencies within the business
SKU Management:
•    Work alongside the Junior Planner managing ladder-plans on Always On products, driving solutions to optimize inventory and sales through the pre-season & in-season forecasting process
•    Proactively drive in-season inventory by SKU, partnering with cross-functional team to create utilization strategies and plans
•    Create process and lead product life cycle to maximize profitability and on-site assortment offering
•    Lead markdown recommendations and pricing in alignment with open-to-buy targets and merchandising strategies
Business Trade Management:
•    Highlight and prepare current business in comparison to trend, plan, and forecast for weekly, monthly, quarterly business review
•    Analyse and identify risks and opportunities to adapt the current business and provide insights to tailor future assortments and buy placements
•    Advise on promotional cadence, lead assortment creation, and go-to-market aligned to Western Europe Digital Direct strategies
•    Manage seasonal set up in the planning tools
•    Present product learning and trends during range reviews and in trade reviews
WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH
In this role, it is critical to build strong relationships and partner with Buying, Allocation and Digital Merchandising alongside Marketing, Finance, Supply Chain, Demand Planning and Inbound Management to achieve the targets for Digital Direct sales, margin and inventory as outlined in the seasonal plans. The Planner will be active in the global planning community, sharing your knowledge and best-practice in the planning centre of excellence evolution. This role reports into the Senior Planning Manager for Western Europe Digital Direct.
